body.p: The previous version of IAS 36 required that if an active market exists for the output produced by an asset or a group of assets:

li.p: that asset or group of assets should be identified as a cash‑generating unit, even if some or all of the output is used internally; and
management’s best estimate of the future market prices for the output should be used in estimating:
the future cash inflows that relate to the internal use of the output when determining the value in use of this cash‑generating unit; and
the future cash outflows that relate to the internal use of the output when determining the value in use of the entity’s other cash‑generating units.
